sn1.33:0.2: 4. The Host of a Hundred Felicities
sn1.33:1.2: Then, late at night, several glorious deities of the host of a hundred felicities, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha, bowed, and stood to one side.
sn1.33:1.3: Standing to one side, one deity expressed this heartfelt sentiment in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.33:3.1: Then another deity expressed this heartfelt sentiment in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.33:4.2: Even when one has little, giving is good.
sn1.33:5.1: Some who have little are happy to provide,
sn1.33:5.2: while some who have much don’t wish to give.
sn1.33:6.1: Then another deity expressed this heartfelt sentiment in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.33:7.2: Even when one has little, giving is good.
sn1.33:7.3: And it’s also good to give out of faith.
sn1.33:7.4: Giving and warfare are similar, they say,
sn1.33:7.5: for even a few of the good may conquer the many.
sn1.33:7.6: If a faithful person gives even a little,
sn1.33:7.7: it still brings them happiness in the hereafter.”
sn1.33:8.1: Then another deity expressed this heartfelt sentiment in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.33:9.2: Even when one has little, giving is good.
sn1.33:9.3: And it’s also good to give out of faith.
sn1.33:9.4: And it’s also good to give legitimate wealth.
sn1.33:10.1: A personage who gives legitimate wealth,
sn1.33:10.2: earned by his efforts and initiative,
sn1.33:10.3: has passed over Yama’s Vetaraṇī River;
sn1.33:10.4: that mortal arrives at celestial fields.”
sn1.33:11.1: Then another deity expressed this heartfelt sentiment in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.33:12.2: Even when one has little, giving is good.
sn1.33:12.3: And it’s also good to give out of faith.
sn1.33:12.4: And it’s also good to give legitimate wealth.
sn1.33:12.5: And it’s also good to give intelligently.
sn1.33:13.1: The Holy One praises giving intelligently
sn1.33:13.2: to those worthy of offerings here  <j>in the world of the living.
sn1.33:13.3: What’s given to these is very fruitful,
sn1.33:13.4: like seeds sown in a fertile field.”
sn1.33:14.1: Then another deity expressed this heartfelt sentiment in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.33:15.2: Even when one has little, giving is good.
sn1.33:15.3: And it’s also good to give out of faith.
sn1.33:15.4: And it’s also good to give legitimate wealth.
sn1.33:15.5: And it’s also good to give intelligently.
sn1.33:15.6: And it’s also good to be restrained  <j>when it comes to living creatures.
sn1.33:16.1: One who lives without harming any living being
sn1.33:16.2: does no bad because of others’ blame.
sn1.33:16.3: Were that the case they praise the coward, not the brave;
sn1.33:16.4: for the virtuous do no bad out of fear.”
sn1.33:17.1: Then another deity said to the Buddha,
sn1.33:18.1: “You’ve all spoken well in your own way. However, listen to me also:
sn1.33:19.1: A gift of faith is praised in many ways,
sn1.33:19.2: but a passage of teaching is better than giving,
sn1.33:19.3: for the virtuous, in days old and older still,
